papers.title: GNU Radio and the USRP:  Building a Community and an FPGA-based Software Radio
authors: GNU Radio is a free software project for software radio. Matt Ettus joined the project shortly after it was founded in 2001. He soon realized that for the project to be truly successful
it needed low cost hardware on which to build those radios
and so he designed the Universal Software Radio Peripheral (USRP) in 2003 and 2004. Since then
both projects have achieved significant growth and success. In 2010
and it continues to produce products and free software for the community. This talk will cover the history of both projects
some of the technical details of the FPGA-based hardware architecture
and the community experience over its 12 years of active development.
